title: [Large-Scale] Rational Instructional Design and Core Competency Model Application for Nurse Orientation Program Reorganization

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic nursing duties and possession of clinical experience
context.additional_context: Establishing instructional design strategies for efficient orientation programs in large-scale workforce reduction and rapid turnover situations.

learning_goals: Applying the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation), learners restructure a new nurse orientation program into three core modules (job training, hospital systems, patient safety) within one week. They submit a plan specifying â‰¥3 concrete learning objectives and evaluation methods (quizzes, simulations, checklists) per module, meeting a 90% completeness standard.
Ensure alignment (80%+ achievement) between learning objectives, assessments, and activities through competency-based curriculum development
Design efficient knowledge delivery methods for large learner groups (30+) in mobile microlearning environments
Develop an orientation process that maintains organizational mission and reduces costs during workforce reduction
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
